candidates.title: Add Yoke example with closure that writes data out
candidates.body:
See #4908

CC @G33KatWork

candidates.title: Fix bugs in several calendars with new continuity test
candidates.body:
Fixes #2703
Fixes #4914
Mostly fixes #2713

I wrote a test that checks for invariants on calendar behavior. In addition to ISO round-trip, it tests simple day-based calendar arithmetic, which is supported in all calendars, and it exercises a lot of code paths that aren't otherwise covered, such as month length, year length, and leap year status, which unveiled bugs in multiple calendars (Observational Islamic, Saudi Islamic, Hebrew, Chinese, Coptic, and Ethiopian).

There are several loosely related changes in this PR so I made an effort for it reviewable commit-by-commit.

candidates.title: Don't enable datagen networking feature when not needed
Add support for BlobSchemaV2Bigger
Organize workspace deps and reenable default features where appropriate
candidates.body:
Fixes https://github.com/unicode-org/icu4x/issues/4843

Alternatively we could re-enable all the features manually, but that's brittle, and I'd rather use the default features.

We should probably check all the other crates, too. In general I think we should use default features for datagen deps.

candidates.title: Implement Generic Type for Convertible Entities
candidates.body:
**Implement Generic Type for Convertibles in `UnitsConverter`**

This PR introduces a Generic Type for convertibles within the `UnitsConverter`. This enhancement allows for diverse converting types and reduces cloning costs, as converters now only manage a single conversion rate and one offset. Additionally, it speeds up calculations by eliminating the need to repeatedly convert from `IcuRatio` to convertible types for each conversion request.

For integration, convertibles are required to implement a series of functions that facilitate the conversion of values between different convertible entities.

candidates.title: Switch to harfbuzz funcs
candidates.body:
This isn't  quite correct: the design of https://github.com/servo/rust-harfbuzz/pull/197/ requires you to use UnicodeFuncsBuilder and pass in six different objects (and it would be inefficient to clone this object five times).

I guess I should have six loadable objects in this crate that people have to manually set? Potentially with a feature-gated helper that automatically builds a `UnicodeFuncs`.

Alternatively we can update upstream to also allow for a single UnicodeFuncs object.

Thoughts? @sffc

Fixes https://github.com/unicode-org/icu4x/issues/3257
